text: The Teda language, also known as Tedaga, Todaga, Todga, or Tudaga is a Nilo- Saharan language spoken by the Teda, a northern subgroup of the Toubou people who inhabit southern Libya, northern Chad and eastern Niger. A small number also inhabit northeastern Nigeria. Along with the more populous southern dialect of Daza, the northern Teda dialect constitutes one of the two varieties of Tebu. Category:Languages of Africa
title: Teda language
